definition: lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy

sentences.english: BDBD hedge anger snarls Han Jinquan Han Jinquan can only apology.
sentences.chinese: 魏东篱气得怒骂韩金铨，韩金铨只能连连道歉。

sentences.english: The sixth chapter "the Yuan Can Article States Discusses": Analyzes Yuan Can's write Style and doctrine attainments in Buddhist.
sentences.chinese: 分析袁粲嬉笑怒骂的文风及其在佛法中的造诣。

sentences.english: Black mule denounced ErNian, also looked for oil meat.
sentences.chinese: 黑骡子怒骂二娘，还找过油肉证明。

sentences.english: Salt-water soaked and shivering he snarls at the incoming tide.
sentences.chinese: 海水慢慢浸入，因恐惧而发抖的他怒骂涌入的海浪。

sentences.english: How can I denounce those whom the Lord has not denounced?
sentences.chinese: 耶和华没有怒骂的，我焉能怒骂？

sentences.english: How can I denounce those whom the Lord has not denounced?
sentences.chinese: 耶和华没有怒骂的，我焉能怒骂？

definition: to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
